title: Orlin Vallecillo
text:
Orlin Jared Vallecillo Paguada (born July 1, 1983) is a Honduran <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> <a href="Goalkeeper%20%28association%20football%29">goalkeeper</a>, who currently plays for <a href="C.D.%20Honduras">Honduras Progreso</a> in the <a href="Liga%20Nacional%20de%20Ascenso%20de%20Honduras">Honduran second division</a>.
Club career.
Vallecillo started his career at <a href="C.D.%20Marath%C3%B3n">Marathón</a> and played for <a href="Hispano%20F.C.">Hispano</a> and <a href="Real%20C.D.%20Espa%C3%B1a">Real España</a>. In December 2008 he moved to <a href="C.D.%20Real%20Juventud">Real Juventud</a> with whom he got relegated in May 2009 before returning to Hispano a month later and then <a href="C.D.%20Marath%C3%B3n">Marathón</a> ahead of the 2010 Clausura. He joined <a href="C.D.%20Victoria">Victoria</a> for the 2012 Clausura and <a href="C.D.%20Honduras">Honduras Progreso</a> for the 2013 Apertura.
International career.
Vallecillo made his debut for <a href="Honduras%20national%20football%20team">Honduras</a> in a March 2007 <a href="friendly%20match">friendly match</a> against <a href="El%20Salvador%20national%20football%20team">El Salvador</a>, when he came on as a late sub for <a href="Noel%20Valladares">Noel Valladares</a>, and has earned a total of 8 caps, scoring no goals. He has represented his country at the <a href="2007%20CONCACAF%20Gold%20Cup">2007 CONCACAF Gold Cup</a> and was a non-playing squad member at the <a href="2011%20CONCACAF%20Gold%20Cup">2011 CONCACAF Gold Cup</a>.
His final international was an August 2007 <a href="friendly%20match">friendly match</a> against <a href="El%20Salvador%20national%20football%20team">El Salvador</a>.
Personal life.
His brother, <a href="Erick%20Vallecillo">Erick Vallecillo</a>, has also played for <a href="Real%20C.D.%20Espa%C3%B1a">Real España</a> and the national team.
